result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Not guilty pleas entered and received. Cases are referred to Branch 5 to schedule a STC.

9:29 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Gary L. Bennis not in court.  Attorney Matthew Krische in court for Gary L. Bennis.
Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Authorization to Appear and Act by Attorney Matthew Krische

Conditions:

(Case called at 11:01 AM)
Defendant Gary Bennis appears with Attorney Matthew Krische.  Attorney Afton Lewis appears for the State of WIsconsin.
Defense waives reading of the Complaint.  State requests to keep the posted money as cash bond.  Defense objects. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on: 7/13/2022 at 3:15 PM
Return Hearing: 8/08/2022 at 9:30 AM
CK 44039 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail posted refunded.

Conditions:
No contact with E.B. in any way.

Order to Quash Bench Warrant.
It is ordered, pursuant to the filing and statements of the defense counsel that Gary Bennis will appear before the court on June 30, 2022 at the 11:00 initial appearance timeslot, the bench warrant for Gary Bennis is quashed.
